page.title: 20SUMMING UP...AND THANKS.
page.content: This then is our 3x4 km. D Block... mainly rural with agricultural land and woodland. The farms have remained substantially unchanged through the years with cereal crops,soft fruit and hops.Several farms now feature "Pick your own" fruit.There are 2 villages, a residential area on the outskirts of Canterbury,a small industrial estate,3 Conservation areas,and 7 Educational establishments. Many thanks to the children and parents of Miss Korbelik's and Mrs Stokes's classes,who went out and about conducting interviews and looking at the land.Thanks also to the people who kindly gave their time to be interviewed...the Head teachers, Reserve Wardens,St. Stephens residents, and Tyler Hill villagers. The photographs were taken by Mrs. B.Stokes, between May & July 1985
